I wrote a couple of songs which needed variations in terms of sentences and rhymes, but I could only find very strange suggestions or very little rhymes choice for a word. When I did the same search via Google search, I was much more lucky and could finish my songs. The algorithms are not working the way I was expecting, hence why, I wouldn't recommend this app and had to cancel my subscription after a couple of months trying to work my way round.

My name is Micheal Towers.  I am the original creator of Masterwriter.  I now believe that Masterwriter is a complete waste of time and money. Let me say it again Masterwriter is a complete waste of time and money, as are most of the features of most song writing programs. The only thing a song writing program is good for is organization and a rhyming dictionary. Other than that it's just a time-wasting tech tool.       The other big problem with Masterwriter is that you have to pay for it on a monthly basis. You should be able to buy the program and be done with it.         Another problem with Masterwriter is the design of version 3. In my opinion it really sucks. They would have you believe that all the changes in Masterwriter 3 are  major and important. In reality it's the same program as Version 2 with a few minor this and thats.         Don't be fooled! It's a complete waste of your time. Spend more time writing songs and less time tangled up in technology.  John Lennon, Paul McCartney and Bob Dylan did not have Masterwriter.  Study their songs not the technology of writing programs.       And finally the idea that you're going to write a novel or screenplay with Masterwriter is absurd.

It's Micheal Towers again. Just so you remember my relationship with Songwriting Software, I built Masterwriter. These are my next comments about Songwriting Software.I do not like the new design of Masterwriter. The black design is annoying, at least it is for me.The new comments about writing songs versus building your vocabulary are a  large waste of time. I am just writing songs. I don't care about my building my vocabulary I just care about writing great songs, period!!!All songs come from life's experiences. So if you want to write better songs study your life's experiences.  Dictionaries will help you write better songs. Building your vocabulary is a nice idea but I don't use Songwriting Software to build my vocabulary I use it to aid me in writing songs.  That's all there is. Songwriting Software will not write songs but it can help you write better songs. The two things all Songwriting Programs should have, a great rhyming dictionary and a great thesaurus. These two dictionaries will help you write better songs. The mind, the imagination and the heart will help you create new songs.Songwriting Software can help you write better songs. All great songs come from the imagination, that's it. Writing dictionaries will help you write better songs. I wrote the dictionaries in Masterwrter and in the building of these dictionaries, it grew my vocabulary but it did not help me to write songs. Remember in the end, it's all about writing songs.

Review.Titre: MasterWriter after use for about 2 months
Review.Contenu: I’ve been using MasterWriter for about 2 months.  It’s a fine “application” but not great.  What this website (yes website, not application) needs is a good competitor.  MasterWriter can be very funky and even annoying in how it performs basic functions - think Microsoft Word in the 1990s; it has a long way to go to be great.  An example, the search bar at the top has an “x” to delete current searches. You better have super accurate finger attack because it requires pinpoint accuracy to clear your current word search.  I routinely have to touch the “x” 4 or 5 times to erase my current search to clear it for a new search.   There are some cool functions, like organizing projects, Word Families and Speech Types.  I find myself too often going to Rhymezone for basic things like looking for synonyms by rhythm pattern (accent/unaccent) and for a broader array of rhymes.  When a viable alternative comes around I will be very open to a change.

I've been with MasterWriter from the beginning of their company.  Which wasn't subscription.  I personally do not like the subscription model especially for this product.   There are times where I need to use this product and internet connection was sketchy.   Don't like being tethered to the internet.  That's why I gave the rating I gave.  If a product appears on the market that's not tethered to the internet, where you pay for the product once,  I'm all for it!

it's ok, the interface is hit or miss, the web access is single only.To elaborate on it's ok, there is a decent amount of word choices to help you write lyrics in different styles. The interface is responsive (changes) in both tablet and phone but the menu system is clunky in providing options.To elaborate on single only, if I'm working on my pc at home but go out and need to do something quick on my phone it logs me out of home which is not helpful i.e. I left it open at home for a reason, and it wasn't to cheat anyone out of paying a subscription.

The interface looks a little dated and really doesn't give me much more power in its layout to justify using it over software like Word, which I already bought, and can use juat as robustly. But I have used that software for a very long time. This may be a good tool for people who need another perspective to write.

Review.Titre: It is excellent but a long way from being modern and having utility.
Review.Contenu: It is excellent, but unlike the trends, it is a program in isolation, so it gets much less used than it should. As they have poor thesauruses, it should plug into Word processors, ProWritingAid, or other checkers. It is not convenient and not integrated into my activity. Therefore, what it does, is costly. Grammarly sits on top of whatever I write. So should Master Writer. It should offer alternatives to many overused words. It needs to check the work, not be a passive blob waiting to be used. I have used it for years and have seen it as a program fall behind as others have raced ahead in usefulness.Since Chat GPT and Bing, it makes the search for alternate words and ways of expressing a concept so much easier for me as a writer. This will make it even harder for Masterwriter. The best result for me as a writer would be for Masterwriter to be available in Grammarly. Grammarly offers alternate words, but its thesaurus is poor. I only need the thesaurus, I rarely use the other features of Masterwriter other than perhaps word definitions. AI is making research and so many parts of being a writer so much easier. When I first reviewed Masterwriter I gave it five stars but the world has moved on.

Review.Contenu: I like the program except for the fact I am unable to open a download onto My Documents. It says it is there, but will not open. So far I have not written a lengthy piece, but this would be a problem if I do!

Review.Titre: No easy miracles for songwriters here.
Review.Contenu: I think I bought into this helping me write better songs - which isn’t possible for a computer program.

Review.Titre: I have not tried the product yet had a…
Review.Contenu: I have not tried the product yet had a computer issue and needed to reinstall so I lost the download, and any time I didn't get to use the service

Review.Titre: MasterWriter is now just a website NOT an App.
Review.Contenu: MasterWriter does have a lot of useful features for songwriters / lyricists BUT the decision to switch to a web only format – basically MasterWriter 3.0 is now just a website (not an app like MasterWriter 1.0 and 2.0 were) is a huge mistake. Most creative types need to get away from the distractions of the Internet to find their inspiration and do not want to be glued to it night and day. Bizarrely, MasterWriter 3.0 simply cannot be used without an Internet connection!  It is also hopeless trying to use MasterWriter 3.0 on a mobile phone as those screens are far too small to be able to do much with it. I am not the first person to feel this way. Many colleagues I know who loved MW have given up on it and switched to apps like Rhyme Genie etc. I hope the nice folks at MasterWriter are hearing this feedback about the website only shortcomings and will soon update MasterWriter 3.0 – or create a version v4.0 – to combine the essential usefulness of an app with that of a website. I really like the simple utilitarian design and look of MasterWriter. I just hope they bring it back as an app instead of just a website.REPLY TO MASTERWRITER'S REPLYBeing an online only website also comes with many disadvantages too. Most songwriters prefer to be 'offline' when creating and composing. The Internet is a huge distraction to the creative process. Please reconsider your stance and create a software version rather than it just being a website users have to pay to access.As for using on the phone? Phone screens are simply too small to be practical for this purpose. Even when using a laptop with MasterWriter the available screen size available is too small as it is split in half and feels very cramped compared to writing on Word documents for instance. So to be honest, it just feels gimmicky even having a phone app for this programme. Just a way of trying to justify the price of the subscription website only model that is being pushed.
useful if you are on-line - could be improved to include thesaurus of emotions and traits
The service is helpful. Two recommendations 1) make access less clunky; 2) expand the vocabulary.Thanks
I haven't used it yet.  I have a writing project coming up and I'll try it then.

Review.Titre: Not sold on the value for its subscription price
Review.Contenu: I'm not entirely sold on MasterWriter being a subscription service.  Nothing about the product ever changes.  Sure, I agree that it's useful having MasterWriter and my catalog of songs "in the cloud", but that's about all that justifies a subscription, and the cost of this subscription is high for what it offers.

Masterwriter is a good app, well designed and very useful, however, I personally like to work offline and that's no longer possible. I'd love it if they released a proper mobile app that could work offline.I also find the cost prohibitive. I'd prefer to pay monthly and not be penalised for it.

As I use your software as a beginner song writer I found the rhymes, phrases and word families lacking.  I was hopeful it would help me to find the right words but I suppose my expectations were a little too high.  I use OneNote and google search to accomplish the same things.  This is just my experience as someone working to learn to write songs.

Your customer service doesn’t answer the phone, pretty poor if you ask me. Tried to update my subscription with a discount, no response. I received a response the next day both here and on the phone from MasterWriter.While I was disappointed in how they handle customer service, over the phone, I want to clarify I love the software and think it is very helpful to lyric writing overall.

I have to say I made an error in posting a review of 1 star with the comment below. “Thesaurus is easier to use. Not worth the money”Masterwriters customer service people reached out to me and after discussing with them my review I have to admit that I did not give the product a proper road test and that I reviewed it based on a cursory use of the product. I will give the product a more robust trial and provide more meaningful feedback.

I've had very little use of your product for the following reasons;1- It doesn't work properly on safari (Mac).2- I have to be online to use it and there is a lot of time that I am not online.3- I tend to write when I am away from the studio, sitting in a coffee shop, out in nature or by the beach.4- Not particularly Mac-like, so I find it a little awkward to use - not so user-friendly.5- Your email reminded me that I have a license for the product and haven't made good use of it.   :-(

Review.Titre: Using/navigating MasterWriter for maxium potential - Not sure?
Review.Contenu: Every time I use MasterWriter, I feel like I am missing something. Yet, I don't want to give up on it; I am using it wrong, or it's not intuitive. I realize the two are not the same, but I got Grammarly around the same time I got MasterWriter. As a tool, I use Grammarly so much more.

Review.Titre: It's a means to an end
Review.Contenu: It's a means to an end - I think there's a couple of things that it misses that could make it a 4* or even a 5* on an ergonomic level. The audio recording features seems it could be better.But with all that said I have found that having access to it has increased the amount I am writing.
I think research information is limited; also writing techniques for beginning screenwriters

The problem with this version, unlike my last, is that one has to be online to use it. It remote areas, or during power outages, I cannot use it. I would much prefer downloading it directly onto my computer, as it was previously. So I definitely will not be renewing this version.

Masterwriter has no synonym for the word 'okay' which is how I rate the software. Instead I'm giving a middling review because the website has been of middling use to me. Often I'll use an online thesaurus for free when masterwriter doesn't recognize the word or has a limited list. I would see more value if I was using it for rhyming. I don't use the other sections such as 'speech types' and 'the world' since direct web searching is more useful for those.I don't regret buying a subscription, but I won't be renewing it.

Review.Titre: A good pocket thesaurus beats this…
Review.Contenu: A good pocket thesaurus beats this so-called tool hands down. If I could get my money back, I'd be thrilled. The software is not really useful, it's not convenient to use, and it was completely overrated by its seller. TOTALLY UNAMUSED!!!!!!- I was completely blindsided by the reply I received from Master Writer after having posted the above review. I received a most cordial letter apologizing for my dissatisfaction with the product...AND a full refund of my purchase price. I commend them for their integrity even if I was unhappy with the product and amend my former rating of one star to a neutral three stars. But their integrity actually deserves five stars. -C.C.

Review.Titre: Need side by side version views with the ability to edit between them
Review.Contenu: It would be much better if I could compare different versions side-by-side. As things stand, if I want to do that, I have to use a word processor or text editor. It would be nice to do everything within masterwriter, but that’s not possible right now.

Review.Titre: The interface is not very intuitive
Review.Contenu: The interface is not very intuitive. It would be nice to have a smoother more predictable path to use the tools. It is distracting when trying to create and explore an idea only to  get caught up in where do I go now to find the answers.

Review.Titre: Too expensive, particularly as a subscription service.
Review.Contenu: Master writer is a convenient tool, however it is very expensive for what it is. It isn't easy to cancel either. I assumed that the subscription would end and I would be notified when it was due for renewal but this was not the case. I tried to find ways of cancelling prior to the first year ending, however it wasn't until after it auto renewed that I found the option. Maybe this was user error though.If the price for one year was a permanent price, I would be rating it much higher, but even then it's quite expensive.After receiving a reply from masterwriter and noting some good points made by them, I have refectled upon my review and adjusted.

Review.Titre: Basically, the American Hertiage Dictionary & Thesaurus
Review.Contenu: I already owned the American Heritage Dictionary and Thesaurus disk, and that's pretty-much exactly what this site offers for a screenwriter/novelist.However, the site/program would be helpful to a song writer or poet.
Very few information bulletins, not what I expected from this service.

Review.Titre: I will NOT be renewing my subscription
Review.Contenu: I will NOT be renewing my subscription. I didn't find it as useful as I had expected. It does have some great features and it has helped in some instances, but it isn't as comprehensive as I expected it to be.

Review.Titre: Might work for some, but not for me
Review.Contenu: Nah. Didn't help me write a single song and I've written over 100 of them. Thought it might bring a different approach or twist to the process. I had no luck with it. Just not the way my brain works.

Review.Titre: Love it but need Mac/iOS apps
Review.Contenu: I love MasterWriter, but I really need there to be an app for Mac and ideally also for every other device - being able to access my songs offline and on any device is an absolute necessity.

Review.Titre: Fine product, but not for everyone.
Review.Contenu: This seems to be a fine product for its intended user. Thanks to the easy learning curve, I found out quickly that MasterWriter is not intended for authors who write and revise as I do.

Review.Titre: Found my old version of Masterwriter…
Review.Contenu: Found my old version of Masterwriter easier to use and of course, I owed my copy and didn't have to worry about paying monthly (But I guess all companies have gone to subscription now)

Review.Titre: Great features, but not enough to justify its subscription model.
Review.Contenu: As a freelance songwriter I use Masterwriter every day. It's a powerhouse of creative tools. But I feel like it's either missing features that other free services have (like Rhymezone's Descriptive Words feature) or certain features just don't work as expected, for example, the Word Families dictionary tab seems useful, but most of the time it doesn't come up with any results. Or how spell check underlines incorrect words, but when I right click I just get a paste option that doesn't even work.I love this app,but considering how I haven't seen a single update or bug fix in the months I've been using it, its pricing shouldn't be a monthly subscription. This is definitely an app that I should be able to purchase a lifetime license for.

Review.Titre: Useful tool but would also appreciate a…syllable count would be helpful
Review.Contenu: Useful tool but would also appreciate a syllable counter and chord recognition- like the songcraft website.  Option to share and live real time collab on documents would be amazing toi

Review.Titre: A huge improvement over using google
Review.Contenu: A huge improvement over using google, but it feels hard to use at times. Almost like there is a limited database of words where it will give you the same output as their sales video.

Master Writer is a sophisticated dictionary and Thesaurus.  It has been a big help in diversifying my vocabulary and in improving my word selection.  Other than that, I do not get much help from it.  The help may be there but I am not one to spend hours teaching myself new software.  For example, as far as I can tell, the subcategories of Word families, Phrases, Speech types and the World serve a function but there is no help category to explain the purpose of those subcategories and how to use them.  The filter section is useful for nouns and verbs and useless for other categories like The World, but maybe I do not know how exactly to use it.  Strongly suggest you offer newcomers to your product a help/guide document that takes them through the various options of us that Master Writer offers.
It hasn’t proven to be very useful for fiction writing. I do see how poetry and music writers might love it. If it had metaphors and other figures of speech I would give it a five.

Review.Titre: It's a good product... but used to be a great product.
Review.Contenu: I have used MasterWriter for years, and only recently canceled my subscription. It's a solid product and has a lot under the hood for songwriting - the phrase rhyming was something I found extremely useful and have yet to find a good alternative elsewhere.Ultimately, I ended up canceling because I just don't like the feel of writing in a web view and always requiring an internet connection. I miss the old Version 2 that was an actual piece of installable computer software instead of just a website. I understand the push toward a website instead of offline software because it makes having a monthly subscription much easier, but it's just not as enjoyable to use personally.If I could buy it for life, I would do so. But as it sits right now, I just don't feel like the subscription is worth it.

Master Writer is the best online writing tool out there, but without offline access it is very limiting. There are a host of circumstances that could prevent one from utilizing the many aids available to artists during the creative process. You were the best offline writing toll out there, in your attempts to reach everyone you left behind what made you great to begin with. Why not have the best of both worlds?

The function of the program does what it needs to do but there are some obstacles in the way for a seamless experience. For instances the spell check is so awkward to use and I'm being nice. It slows any flow you have going but for the shake of time the core program is excellent. It does what it's suppose to do, very well. I'm sure in time the proper tweaking will make this program shine even more. It's a buy.

I dislike paying an annual license fee for the program. I prefer to upgrade and pay for the upgrades.  I may not use the program for several months but am still required to pay the license fee each year.  I also prefer downloading the files rather then going to the web page to access the program. I don't believe I will renew my license when my term runs out unless their method of operation changes.

I love the product. I really do. However, for some of us who took the monthly payment option for the program have realized we have paid several times the actual subscription costs. Unfortunately, I may have to leave the relationship since it appears I would have to pay, in full, the entire membership fee to get off the monthly subscription. Brilliant marketing on your part, but not necessarily good financial stewardship on my part.

Review.Titre: Good features, software not very stable yet.
Review.Contenu: I like the basic features but I get a lot of "server not aviailable" type messages. I've had a few times where it seemed to lose my song, but then when I rebooted the song came back. One nice feature would be that if I highlighted a word in my song it would feed that automatically into the rhyming dictionary search window.

Review.Titre: I was really looking forward to…
Review.Contenu: I was really looking forward to MasterWriter. I thought it would be my go-to source when I was stuck or wanted to punctuate my writing with unusual synonyms (e.g., slang expressions, jargon) or idioms that I could play with and add a new twist to. Unfortunately, MasterWriter falls short. There aren't as many choices as I thought there would be.  Instead of using your program  when writing I find myself going to Urban Thesaurus, Reverse Dictionary, Relatedwords.org, the idioms page at the FreeDictionary, and the phrases page at RhymeZone. Those are all open tabs on my browser when I'm working. I did like the price that I paid for your program though. Hence, a third star. Hopefully, you'll end up incorporating the features that seem to be lacking and which would make MasterWriter a truly one-stop source for writers. Sincerely,Timothy

Review.Titre: What do you do when you can't access the internet?
Review.Contenu: I much prefer to have a software version of Masterwriter.  I enjoy taking my laptop to a riverside, a mountain top, or even a campsite.  You get my point.  Having to sit in an area where WiFi is available takes all the romance out of writing a song.  Boo.  Yes, I can access it on my iPhone but it's small and the load time is painful.  This feels like a money move for Masterwiter.   Otherwise the product itself is amazing.  Too bad I find it hard to use when I want to.

This product is good for some I am sure,  it just didn't work for me and I felt that it was a little expensive for what it is.  I canceled the product and I will say that the professionalism shown by this company when I voiced concerns was impeccable . My money was refunded immediately and there was true concern for my reasons for leaving.  I wish I could use the product so I could work with a company like this one, but I didn't feel the expense was worth it at this time.

This program does have an acceptable selection of synonyms, but "word families" is a joke. It is rarely helpful. "Phrases" adds very little as it adds only the very simple and often'd cliched, as is "Rhymes". A simple Webster on line is much more helpful that "Definition". Categories is poorly reference and difficult to use. The "World" is well done.I should be able to type in a phrase to find a one word synonym of the meaning I am looking for. Phrases and Rhymes should be easier to reference from my thoughts, but this program is lacking and difficult to use. Help me say "old eagle eye," or "high as a kite" with one word, then it would be helpful. This program could be beautiful but it needs a lot of work. There are a lot of missing pieces and it needs to be more user friendly.

I wish I could download pdfs of my songs. The rhyming dictionary needs to have better close rhymes. The recording feature is a little awkward to use. I would like to double or right click on a word and get rhymes rather than reenter the word. This feature could also apply to synonyms, etc.

Review.Titre: New software not as easy as the old one.
Review.Contenu: Masterwriter is great for coming up with rhyming words, phrases, synonyms and what not for a songwriter. But they really dropped the ball on this new licensed product. I purchased the original software and was quite satisfied with it. Reluctantly, I decided to go ahead and subscribe to the new product. I am not happy with my decision because there are so many glitches in this product. For example, the print button doesn't always print as it should. The screen is split on the print job and I can not get rid of the split. Annoying to the point of dissatisfaction.

I loved it when it ran on my computer and I could use it all I wanted. Now it's a yearly subscription for a web app. There aren't really any other alternatives out there. If there were I would have switched the minute it became a subscription only product.

I love master writer but do find it limiting in many ways. For one, I can't make it work on all platforms i.e. Ipad pro. Using a Bluetooth keyboard disables some functionality i.e. I am unable to use the enter key for the search tab. It' is temperamental at best. I can not copy any phrases for easy access. There are many glitches and bugs. I would love to see the ability to share songs with other writers for co writes etc...  Again, it's a great idea but not yet amazing. Thank you for all your hard work, I look forward to seeing what you all come up with in the future.

While looking for synonyms I've come back with none found yet MS Word had a selection. For the price, I find that a bit irritating. Also sometimes I can eventually think of the word I wanted to use but was nowhere within the masterwriter suggestions.
as much as I'd like to use MW more, I just can't get in the groove with it.  one thing that may help is seamless interconnection with MS Word

Giant learning curve for some of us. Have not  had time to  work on my written songs as yet so complete evaluation is not forth coming. But i do have high hopes it will serve the purpose of song notation and arranging lyrics to suite the muse. .

Don't like that they've went to subscription.  Hard to export other than cut and paste (would be nice if you could export txt or PDFs).  Work tape/audio function has improved on tablet/desktop, but phone still lackin.

It is bothersome to have to constantly enter my password, no matter if I use bookmarks. The program can be complicated without proper instructions on how to use it. If it wasn't for Youtube I would be completely lost.

Review.Titre: I don’t like the change made in the…
Review.Contenu: I don’t like the change made in the newer version where you have to have an internet connection. I liked the older version better.

Review.Titre: I think it is a better program than it seems... But
Review.Contenu: Having some difficulty because the tutorials are very vague on how to use the program. The tutorials are either there and not easily accessible or just not there. The tutorials I did follow were vague.

Review.Titre: I am not using it as I did back few…
Review.Contenu: I am not using it as I did back few years ago. It seems like the quality or usefulness has dropped....I am very disappointed.

Review.Titre: At least better than the free online rhyming tools
Review.Contenu: I use Masterwriter exclusively for songwriting/lyric writing.  I can't honestly say that I recall Masterwriter every really being of all that much help in discovering new, useful rhymes.  Maybe if you are a novelist and you are looking for lists of synonyms, antonyms, phrases, etc. Masterwriter is probably more useful.  And for lyric writing it is at least better than the free online stuff.  But I can accurately say that Masterwriter has never given me that one "ah-ha" rhyme that I could have never have come up with on my own.  To be fair it does get your brain churning which helps you self-discover the words you are really looking for.  I would give it 2 stars but as it is at least better than the free online rhymers I upped it to 3 stars.

I think the writing features are top knotch.  It's easy to use and I enjoy working with it.  I just don't think it's fair that it has to be tied to the internet to use it and for that reason I keep version 2 on my computer when I don't want to use the subscription model on the internet to do some writing.  Not sure if I will keep 3 after another year because I don't use a data plan so I have to make sure there is Wifi when I am out and about.  I mean version 2 was so good anyway that with the addition of Rhyme Genie I don't think anything could really compete with the 2 of them together.  Masterwriter 2 "felt" like it was MY program.  Subscriptions feel like rentals.  But feature wise I can't complain about version 3.

Love the product. Couple things I would change1) Masterwriter app on iPhone: I'm a singer and songwriter as I would expect most of your customers are. I downloaded the app in hopes that it would mirror the web interface to an extent, allowing me to quickly access lyrics when I'm in a vocal session or being able to make changes on the fly. The functionality of the app is so limited, it's not really worth downloading in its current state. So much potential here though, would be amazing if there was a major update in the near future. 2) Web interface: Slow reaction times with Safari, blank menu windows. Noted several glitches when scrolling through the pages. 3) Colour customisability: Would be great to be able to customise the colour and break away from the blue.Hope this helps!
I love everything about the content on Masterwriter and it is quite helpful, but it has absolutely abysmal functionality on the iPhone.  Very frustrating.

Review.Titre: Not as helpful as I'd hoped
Review.Contenu: Either I just don't get how it works or it's not what i needed for the books I write. have other tools that help me much better and are free.

Review.Titre: I just didn't find it to be anymore…
Review.Contenu: I just didn't find it to be anymore helpful than using Scrivener or other word processors.
I am having difficulty using MasterWriter and some instructive help would be appreciated.

Review.Titre: Haven't started using the program yet.
Review.Contenu: I haven't had time to view the video and afraid I can't figure it out on my own. Hoping to have a look in the next several days.
The idea is wonderful, but it is too manual. Google searches work better for me.

Review.Titre: This was not more helpful than…
Review.Contenu: This was not more helpful than thesaurus.com or other search engines that are free.
I miss the offline option. Please include an OS app and easy way to license songs.
MasterWriter times out too quickly.  Too much time is spent logging in and out.
Good source for alternate words, but not as intuitive as I would have liked.

Review.Titre: Great Application, But a Bit Pricey!
Review.Contenu: In all honesty, I love Master Writer; it has helped me immensely in writing new lyrics and also finishing/polishing some very old lyrics that were unfinished. The fact that there are so many tools available to me from within the MR application without having to scour the internet for rhymes, words and ideas is fantastic and really helps keep the momentum of writing stay constant.  I would like to see some templates added that would allow a more professional outline and finished work in writing; spelling out main lyrics, choruses, instrumental interludes and codas. Maybe correctly adding the name of the composer, dates, copyright information, etc. Automatically adding the composer/writer name; setting up the font size and location for the title, etc.  My biggest complaint would be that the subscription is way too high for an application that rarely, if ever, changes or is updated. I would prefer a stand alone, desktop app that is free of any subscription. Maybe has upgrade options to purchase for additional functionality, or some other value added service to make the subscription at least [seem] worthwhile. In ending, I love the Master Writer application. But after "Years" of use, and payments, I cannot really see the benefit of an ongoing subscription.
Rhymes listed not always "perfect" or based on sloppy pronunciation
good product but disappointed in that edit page is still too small

Review.Titre: Some services do not work as advertised.

Review.Contenu: Masterwriter is ok but not nearly as easy to use as I had hoped.

Absolutely fabulous. I’d recommend a couple improvements. The word family function rarely provides anything useful. I came over from another app that has a great word family function. Masterwriter usually just says nothing found for this word. Try synonyms. The competitions app when you type the word ‘gun’ for example will say bullet, black, dangerous, hollow tip, shooting, war, NRA, safety, policeman, etc etc etc. and just give words “in the key of gun” so to speak. Another frustrating thing about this app is digging through some of the speech types, there can sometimes be 150 separate pages to sift through but no way to jump ahead or alphabetically search. Just endless page flipping. Other than these two things you guys are crushing it. Loving the app.

Review.Titre: I have not yet used the new Master…
Review.Contenu: I have not yet used the new Master Writer, but I have used Master Writer in the past.  The only reason I gave a 4-star, instead of a 5-star, is due to the fact that the program is not downloaded onto the PC.  I like to be in total control.  Thank you!
It’s a great app. I just wish it was actually an app. Like for iphone/android rather than a web based app that sits in my browser lost amongst all the other open tabs.

Review.Titre: I have just started to use Masterwriter…
Review.Contenu: I have just started to use Masterwriter after having used Songwriter’s Pad forever.  It’s as good or better than my old app, and similarly not without its warts.The fact that the MW mobile app is not the same in functionality as the desktop version is not a surprise, but is no less frustrating.That said, it’s a great app.  I wish it was less subscription and more one time purchase, but I’m happy enough.

Review.Titre: MW is a great tool to improve the lyric…
Review.Contenu: MW is a great tool to improve the lyric writing. As a non native english speaker, i use it a lot when i need a rhyme , a synonym or an english expression that i'm not familiar with. And i can write all my lyrics on it directly and find them easily. There are probably other functions that i don't use and i still need to discover.
Masterwriter is really helpful. I like the rhymes, near rhymes, and phrases...all very helpful and inspiring when writing songs.

Review.Titre: Waiting for a standalone iPad app
Review.Contenu: It's great!  All of the tools (rhyming, thesaurus, dictionary), all in one place, and very inspiring.  Just wish it was available as a standalone app, either on iPad or Mac/PC like it used to be.

Very handy to have the dictionary and thesaurus and the other tools close at hand. The Versions feature is quite useful. Normally I am not quick to use web apps for intellectual property, but it is convenient to have access to my lyrics from anywhere. I have several features I would like added. Nonetheless, this app is worth the price. It is money well spent.

Masterwriter has provided help in coming up with words, but I find I am still having use my browser to come up with synonyms that fit my needs. So it has become another tool for me, but not my go-to tool as yet.

Mostly I use word families, synonyms, phrases, speech types, and dictionary sections. I do use the world section but not as often. I'm a writer, not a songwriter, but it is quite a useful tool when I'm polishing my work.
Plenty of synonyms. Otherwise not so useful to me. Perhaps my issue, not theirs.
This is a great tool for my songwriting career. It helps me find words that is not familiar with me & appropriately you have a choice for the right tune and words matching together for the theme.

Copying and pasting (eg into a word file) and organising new versions of the same song under titles etc is all there but a bit clunky. Also, i have to use a different program to write chord charts, or at least that is my current practice. Still a great program.

Review.Titre: Few things I’d change but amazing nonetheless
Review.Contenu: I love it, it’s an amazing resource for songwriting and poetry!! I would change a few things though on the mobile website, like maybe having the rhyme words on the auto fill bar instead of having to exit out of the writing entirely? I find the navigation is quite annoying, I hope I don’t sound entitled lmfao I’m sorry. maybe have a lot more rhyme words too? PLEASE PLEASE PLEASE MAKE AN APP THAT WOULD BE AMAZING!!! That’s my number one request and I’m sure others too ❤️‍🔥But that’s it! Everything else is amazing, thanks for designing this amazing resource❤️‍🔥

Solid.  Has everything I need for lyric writing, as I'm a terrible lyricist.  Lol.  Rhyming dictionary is the best I've seen.  My only gripe is I'd like to see a standalone app for iOS/Android, and an offline mode, as I'm not always online 24/7.

I've loved MasterWriter since the beginning and will continue to use it when I write lyrics.   It's a great source of inspiration, and it keeps getting better.   It'll someday get a 5 star review from me I'm sure.   Keep up the good work!!

Easy to use, very useful! Word Families is extremely awesome. It can lag a little at times, but that might be my pc. Also, it went on sale like a few days after I bought 2 years for full price, but that's just timing I guess. Maybe a lifetime payment option? Some text sections/files in the Help Center would be nice. Also instant showing of words on the left, or like an option for a scratchpad that does this, something along those lines. Still new to it though so working with it. All in all, very useful for fiction, really digging it so far!

Love it so far. I have several improvements to suggest:1.) iOS and Android Apps2.) The ability to email files bigger than 10mb. These days, many files are larger than that.3.) The ability to "Save As" new versions of songs rather than copy and paste, etc.4.) API integrations with on line services like Box.com, DropBox.com and Avid Cloud. The more integrations the better.Happy to discuss any of the above with your team. Just let me know.Thanks!Ramin Keyvan

Review.Titre: Great tool, perhaps easier to use for native speakers

The company's owner reached out to me to ask me personally about what my experience was and cared about my experience. We mutually agreed that, for now, it's not the tool I need, but I did appreciate he reached out to me. I got a refund, which I didn't ask for, and there was no need to do so as I did use the tool and see it as part of trying out something new. MasterWriter might be the perfect tool for writers and perhaps easier to use for native speakers; if you do have a problem, I can tell you this: reach out to the company. They will (unlike so many others) respond and help you out immediately.

Disclaimer: this is a edit of a previous review.I use MasterWriter for songwriting, so I mostly search Rhymes. Ha. It's not fair to blame MasterWriter for not finding the rhyme I'm looking for. The app has a vast offering of perfect, close, wider, and widest rhymes. It runs rings round my Songwriter's Rhyming Dictionary. I haven't used MasterWriter much since it moved online. I prefer a standalone app I can open when needed without the online login process. Admittedly this is a personal bias which shouldn't color a review.The developer quickly replied to my initial review, which was short and not flattering. Honestly, I had forgotten about the app until I received a request to review it. Online apps are not my thing. My recollection was often not finding the rhymes I needed. (Please see the first paragraph.) Perhaps it was the process of searching that interrupted my writing--not a fault of the app. The developer's outreach prompted me to log in and take another look. I found a more robust version offering more content than I recalled. "Speech Types" is a new addition, with categories for Alliterations, Allusions, Idioms, Intensifiers, Metaphors, Onomatopoeia, Oxymorons, and Similes. That looks very useful, especially since you can filter by the number of syllables required.I'm going to give MasterWriter another try. I still don't like the online app process. But the site has many useful features. It looks like a one-stop shop for words. Users will have to determine if that is true for themselves. I'm giving it the second look it deserves.I've updated my rating to four stars. It may deserve five stars. I need to explore the new version before I can say. Will I use MasterWriter more now? Hard to say. I'm not often at my computer when I'm writing songs. Again, no fault to the online app.Bottom line -- the developer takes this seriously. Serious writers may benefit from  giving MasterWriter a look. How it fits into a writer's workflow may have a say in whether it is a useful tool or not. MasterWriter certainly has a lot of words to use. The developer's desire to help users is a big plus, as well.

Review.Titre: MasterWriter now a website not an app.
Review.Contenu: I've upgraded my review from 3 Stars to 4. Matthew from MasterWriter has been very responsive. I sincerely hope they'll soon be able to bring back offline working mode for us songwriters who travel a lot and are away from Internet.  ***********I have used MasterWriter on and off since Version 1. I do have a soft spot for it and have tried to stay loyal to the company but I really do not like the fact it is now just a website and no longer dedicated software. You have to be online and tied to the Internet to use it. I think this is a big mistake and does put off quite a lot of people I have spoken to about it. In fact, no one I have spoken to prefers this new version to the older software version - which no longer runs on modern Macs. Many songwriters – myself included – crave time away from the Internet to be able to clear our heads and create away from its distractions. Another issue for me is the very cramped size of the writing area for lyrics. It is very small even on a laptop, but on a phone I find it not useable at all.  As I remember, the older software versions use to have an additional sketchpad / notes area where you could play around with your words in extra space before bringing across to the main lyrics area on the left hand side. Lastly, I really do not like the subscription model they have introduced. You are not even paying for software. You are paying a monthly or annual fee to access a website. I would rather pay for software that exists on my computer and then pay again for significant upgrades. There have been no major upgrades in Master Writer for many years -apart from the dubious one of it now being a website that you can access with your phone! I hope the folks at Master Writer take note of this feedback and bring it back as independent software. I am not meaning to be negative at all but I don’t think MW has evolved enough since it was first launched many years ago. There is something I do still like about it but from a personal point of view its usability is now going backwards, not forwards with the demotion to being just a website and not freestanding software. PLEASE bring it back as software!IN RESPONSE TO MASTERWRITER'S REPLY:1. I do find it hard to believe there is overwhelming demand for a web-based program on a subscription model. I know a lot of creative people in the fields of music, photography and film and absolutely all of them resent being forced into the subscription model by the likes of ProTools, Adobe etc. as well as being unable to use their creative tools without being tied to the Internet. In regards to MasterWriter, the value of being able to work away from the distractions of the Internet (on a tour bus, airplane, train, remote cottage etc.) is far greater than the value of being able to access the website on a small phone screen. There is a growing resentment in the creative community – generally – that the subscription model is based more upon the financial needs of the software creators than the creative needs of the software users who – in effect – no longer own what they are paying for. Also, the fact that our work no longer resides on our own computers / hard drives but on someone else's hard drive (which is basically what the cloud and web-based apps are ... just someone else's hard drive). 2. Yes, I did notice that by hovering the cursor over the black separator bar I can pull the writing area on my MacBook Pro out to the right by approx. 1.5” (4cm) which does help slightly. I agree with you, that the writing area on the phone is too small due to the limitations of the phone itself. My suggestion would be to revert to a software model where several full pages can be opened up at once – like Word documents – and exist fully side by side rather than the very limited real estate allowed by a webpage. 3. Agreed. The new ‘Versions’ feature is an improvement over the old sketchpad. 4. When using Versions 1 and 2 of MasterWriter I noticed there were barely any software updates over many years. Is there an area on the main website where we can see which updates and improvements are being implemented and where users can make suggestions for improvements? It would be nice to feel we are part of a community working together to improve MasterWriter. Lastly, a practical question. Does MW only send out text files in .html format? Could there be an option added in preferences where files could be sent in simple TextEdit format? As again, if one is trying to open up MW text files offline then .html format is of little use. Audio files work fine though. I wish to reiterate that I am a supporter of MasterWriter and have enjoyed using it since Version 1. I just want to help make it better and increase its appeal as there is still much I like about it. I also wish to thank you for being so responsive on this forum. Hopefully, the views of users can be taken on board for future upgrades.
Simplicity...enjoyed it and love the expansive vocab.

This program is useful. Honestly, as a rhyming dictionary, the color coding and syllable counter of Rhymer's Block is easier to use, but has far less depth. Masterwriter helps when you are stuck. For the price, they should develop more features though. I am interested in a writing tool, and not a way to push my songs (that doesn't seem very useful).

able to  work with word processor in tandem

Also has no way of tracking pitches or if/when a song is on hold or has been recorded. SongSpace is the gold standard for those things. As a result, I have to use both, not one or the other.

Review.Contenu: I love a lot of the features of your app. Could I give you some constructive criticism for hopefully some change? With a laptop I wish there was options to make the screens bigger and the fonts bigger. I don't have the best eyesight and constantly have to put reading glasses on. Perhaps when I'm in the section just writing lyrics I would love to expand that section to fill up my entire screen instead of just a small portion on the left which is more difficult to read. Thank you for your consideration!

Review.Titre: I love the platform for storing…
Review.Contenu: I love the platform for storing information, lyrics, ideas and notes. Masterwriter is great at this. The fact that it is accessible on mobile devices is a huge plus. I am able to record a lyrical thought immediately before its lost.Where I don't get a lot of value are the Rhymes, Synonyms, etc. I have reverted back to Rymezone.com and Thesaurus for these needs. That said. I plan to continue using Masterwriter as a useful tool and would definitely recommend it to others.

Review.Titre: Master writer is a great program that…
Review.Contenu: Master writer is a great program that fuels the writing process creatively. It’s easy to use with only a few weaknesses. It provides me with alternate ideas with my lyric writing which I love.I’ve been using it for well over 15 years so I’m a long term fan but there are never any incentives for long term users. Not sure why ?  but that would be my greatest criticism … sometimes it’s good to give back :)I’m grateful either way because I think it’s the best at what it does. Thumbs up Paul

Review.Titre: Great; Could Be Better; Might Get There
Review.Contenu: There are some elements to the organization/folder system that could use some improvement, and may get them in future revisions (the current version has improved over the previous). But otherwise, a word processing program with an integrated thesaurus and particularly, afull featured, rhyming dictionary is indispensable for songwriting. That it's a cloud app is convenient for those times when you only have your phone on you (though the phone interface could use some improvement, as well).

Review.Titre: The only thing I would add to this…
Review.Contenu: The only thing I would add to this great program is the ability to use it offline.  I realize that wouldn't work for the full program, but certainly there are parts that could. It is frustrating at times when I need to look up words or phrases and find I need to go online to use MasterWriter, so I don't.

THE SOFTWARE IS REALLY USEFUL. ADMITTEDLY I DON'T USE ALL THE FEATURES THAT IT OFFERS, BUT I STILL GET VALUE FOR THE COST. THE ONLY PROBLEM I'VE HAD IS THAT THERE ARE SMALL CHANGES TO THE SOFTWARE THAT I DON'T FEEL I WAS ADEQUATELY INFORMED ABOUT. ONE EMAIL TO SUPPORT AND ALL WAS WELL, SO NO BIG DEAL.

Review.Titre: Still trying to figure how to best use…
Review.Contenu: Still trying to figure how to best use it!

Always room for improvement. Sometimes I have to go to wordhippo for additional assistance.The fonts that show dark and clear on computer do not always show as well on phone. Replaced all fonts with Arial Bold. FYI.Other than that, all is well.MiLTON

There are numerous words I can enter into thesaurus.com that can be found on that site, but when they're entered into MasterWriter, I get nothing. Be that as it may, it is a good program, but unfortunately, it can't be the only one you use.

I love the convenience of writing/editing/adding to my projects from anywhere. The "filing" of projects is easy to navigate and keeps my projects in order. The only complaint I have is the uploading of text from other sources. It is a bit cumbersome.

I love MW and use it every day. I’d love to see a sharing feature like a Google Doc for collaborations, as well as the ability to resize or change the layout of the screen.All in all it has improved my songwriting and I recommend it to everyone.

Review.Titre: MasterWriter is very useful for both…
Review.Contenu: MasterWriter is very useful for both screenwriters and songwriters. It provides an extensive list of synonyms. However, the synonyms are not hyperlinked to their synonyms. This would be a very useful feature which is found in other packages of this type.

Review.Titre: I don't like the online subscription…
Review.Contenu: I don't like the online subscription only model!  If it weren't for this I would rate it a 5 star.  In all of the years since MasterWriter was created no other software I have found does what it does.

I have been able to generate some great lyrical ideas, both with new compositions and revisiting some older ones. I would like to be able to use the features of interfacing with my music scores and with recording software better that I can now.

I have been using masterwriter for a couple of years now and find it very helpful. 4 out of 5.The only issue I have is that the tutorials could be more inclusive and updated because I keep on finding out more useful options by trial and error.

The app is very helpful. Lots of assistance at your fingertips. One possible advanced feature could be an intelligent word or phrase suggestion mode that was switchable (on or off) that would operate as you write.

Review.Titre: This is a handy writing tool, but
Review.Contenu: This is a handy writing tool, faster than thesaurus and goes well beyond that. However, it is far from perfect, which is why I gave it up for awhile.  Falls short in silly ways. This is just one example. It couldn't find another word for orange? Duh... how about tangerine? Come on, take a step outside the box. If we are looking for color words, this would suffice.I did come back to it because it's a timesaver, but I need to keep a list of all the times it fails me. Here's another one... relationship. No other word in the world can take the place of this one. I get the message there are no synonyms. How about marriage? Not perfect, but better then nothing.

I really like using MasterWriter. I primarily use it for rhymes, and it's great for that; it includes some inventive stuff that other applications don't have. The web interface makes it easy to use anywhere I am.

Review.Titre: I found that Master Writer is an…
Review.Contenu: I found that Master Writer is an excellent venue for saving lyrics and creating them with the tools they provide. However, is there a way to record your songs and send the recordings to NSAI for evaluation?

Review.Contenu: I've been a MasterWriter user since many years. Having MasterWriter in the creative process is like having a good friend along for the ride watching and making careful suggestions every once in a while.
Easy to use. Inspiring. Love it
Master writer was helpful. Hi loved the analytical tools. I recommend it. My only challenge was there was a learning curve to use it effectively. I’m not sure I ever used it to its fullest.
I like MasterWriter very much! It does take time to get use to how it works and what is is best at. It helps me primarily with song lyrics and rhyming words I may not have thought of.
I have Grammarly and found several discre[pencies. It was good on commas and periods but missed several when it should have been a period. I had higher expectations. Thank you,

Masterwriter is an amazing tool that I use on virtually every song I write. It's a great way to streamline my writing process. My only complaint is that sometimes the web page will freeze on me and I have to refresh the web page to get it working again. This sometimes results in losing a lyric. Other than that I am perfectly happy with Masterwriter.
Very useful! Still a few quirks, but overall a great tool. It would be great to be able to submit rhyme suggestions - sometimes I find one that's missing from the list.

I think this is a wonderful program.  However, there are some glitches I get with working it.  It can freeze when I try to get the mp3 into the page to write the lyrics with it.  I wish there was a manual to go along with it in either html form or pdf form.  Other than that, the thesaurus, rhyming dictionary, regular dictionary help me so much.  Thank you.

I don’t know how to use ALL the features, but what I use, I get a lot out of. My main issue with the program is that it logs you out.....   I’ll be using it, then go into garageband to do some recording, go back to it, and have to log in all over again. I don’t know what the time-out limit is, but I wish it were longer, or I wish there was a button you could click to stay in the program. It’s really upsetting to the flow of writing when you have to log back in.
I love the program. I wish the word processor functions were a little better. Easier access to simple functions like cut, copy & paste would be great.

Review.Titre: I'm a better lyricist because of Masterwriter, but with one suggestion..
Review.Contenu: Only downfall with Masterwriter is, If you pay for a monthly subscription, with each billing cycle, they charge you one day sooner than the previous cycle. Eventually, you will pay for months you don't get to use. I can't be the only one who has caught this and I feel somewhat cheated/manipulated, like, "If they don't notice it, we can get away with it". This turned me off. Other than that, Masterwriter itself has helped tremendously with writer's block.

Review.Titre: Good idea but requires internet to work - I don't like that
Review.Contenu: When I'm writing I want he freedom to create without dependency on an external resource. So I write in my composition book and transcribe to the MW site.   I am also concerned about the security of my original works being compromised - not that I'm that great, but many sites have been hacked, and someone would then have access to a lot of original ideas. I like the suggestions and the import export features.  This software helps to "master" the commposition.

MasterWriter is like an artist's pallete, providing richer verbal color than a simple thesaurus (although sometimes the "best" word selection may still come through MW's thesaurus feature).I do look forward to an upgraded version that operates within Word and allows auto replace. It does allow you to collect your preferred choices for later reflection.Some common words yield surprisingly few search results, BUT the richness and versatility of what IS found makes up for it.

I really like the functionality of your program but I am often offline due to traveling and cannot use your software. I find myself saving the text of a song and working on that in other software when traveling and not connected to the internet. This makes the song making process slightly more complicated.

Review.Titre: This is a very convenient tool for song…

Review.Titre: If you are serious about your craft, MasterWriter is the app for you!

Review.Titre: This software is exactly what I need to…
Review.Contenu: This software is exactly what I need to keep my songs, ideas, etc. organized and accessible from any device.

The software is fantastic. When composing a song and you run into that holdup that you just can't seem to  move forward with you can count MasterWriter to be very helpful. Thanks for creating such amazing product.

Review.Titre: A Great Writing App for Any Writer.
Review.Contenu: The MasterWriter app works well as a word processor, but I find it has so much more to offer any writer. It instantly saves my work and the spell check is very accurate. But, this innovative app can help any writer in whatever field to broaden their writing skills with easy-to-use search categories like word families, synonyms, definitions, phrases, rhymes, and much more. Plus, informative Help Videos are included in the app to get you up and writing quickly. If you write for a living like I do or are just starting your career as a wordsmith, I can highly recommend MasterWriter to you as the most valuable arrow in your quiver.

I don't write a song without MasterWriter.  It's the best all in one tool for songwriters EVER.  With thesaurus, rhymes, definitions, and phrases all in one place, and one place to keep all my lyrics, it keeps me organized!  The ability to write different versions of a song is brilliant.  I started with MasterWriter years ago based on David Foster's endorsement.  I wouldn't be without it.

Quite a confusing format. Not sure how much I’ll use it. Seems to suggest a “new project” every time you look up a word which seems quite counterintuitive.EDITED ADDITION TO REVIEW ABOVE: I had a brilliant response from the company on this - unsurprisingly (to me) it was something I was doing wrong. Matt DeVorzon got in touch and sent me a personalised video, explaining some of the issues I was having, and also how to resolve them with the "dictionaries" function. Essentially, I was trying to create projects each time, rather than the dictionaries button. As I use Word for my writing, I just needed it as a search function, which is now working really well.Extremely impressed with the response and explanations, Masterwriter itself is really useful for any writers who need a wealth of words to choose from. Thanks Matt!

I bought a Master Writer subscription because I've exhausted the built-in dictionary app thesaurus on my Mac. The options M.W. gives me are incredible. It's like it's actually thinking! Haha. This will transform my novel writing!

I've been utilizing MasterWriter for the past month while I undertake the first revision of my novel. The numerous ways to search for the ideal word that elevates my writing is simple and straight forward. Working on a MacBook I was also able to easily launch MasterWriter.com in its own app. It would be great if there was someway to integrate MasterWriter into Scrivener. But for now, I am extremely happy with this indespensible writing tool.
MastrerWrtier is indispensable for writers.  It is of immense help.  The only thing they forgot was the word count... but I know they will add it.They are in process of adding word count.
